result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence M Fountain

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence M Fountain in court.  Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal in court for Terrence M Fountain.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Goebel on November 1st, 2022  at 10:00 am. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence M Fountain appeared by video.  Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal appeared by video for Terrence M Fountain.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 room 623 Courthouse.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case rescheduled for 9/14/2022 at 8:30 am for Status Conference by zoom.

Defendant Terrence M Fountain in court.  Christopher Morgan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a return of property.
Defendant withdraws his petition.
Case calendared fora Return on Property hearing on 7-19-2022. Defendant  moved to withdraw his petition and request to cancel this hearing.

Defendant Terrence M Fountain in court with attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of the some discovery  and missing the State's Offer and request an adjournment. 
State will  forward an Offer to defense counsel 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return of property hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/30/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Terrence M Fountain in court with attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 059789,
Payable Number: 1016406,
Receipt Number: 22RP026219,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @2p
